cds::gc::ptb::details::guard_allocator< ALLOCATOR > Class Template Reference

Guard allocator. More...

#include <ptb.h>

Public Member Functions

guard_data * alloc ()
 Allocates a guard from free list or from heap if free list is empty.
void free (guard_data *pGuard)
 Frees guard pGuard.
guard_data * allocList (size_t nCount)
 Allocates list of guard.
void freeList (guard_data *pList)
 Frees list of guards.
guard_data * begin ()
 Returns the list's head of guards allocated.

Private Member Functions

guard_data * allocNew ()
 Allocates new guard from the heap. The function uses aligned allocator.

Detailed Description

template<class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR>
class cds::gc::ptb::details::guard_allocator< ALLOCATOR >

Guard allocator.

Member Function Documentation

template<class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR>
guard_data* cds::gc::ptb::details::guard_allocator< ALLOCATOR >::allocList ( size_t  nCount ) [inline]

Allocates list of guard.

The list returned is linked by guard's pThreadNext and pNextFree fields. cds::gc::ptb::ThreadGC supporting method

template<class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR>
guard_data* cds::gc::ptb::details::guard_allocator< ALLOCATOR >::allocNew (  ) [inline, private]

Allocates new guard from the heap. The function uses aligned allocator.

Unfortunately, access to the list of free guard is lock-based. Lock-free manipulations with guard free-list are ABA-prone. TODO: working with m_FreeGuardList in lock-free manner.

template<class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR>
void cds::gc::ptb::details::guard_allocator< ALLOCATOR >::free ( guard_data *  pGuard ) [inline]

Frees guard pGuard.

The function places the guard pGuard into free-list

template<class ALLOCATOR = CDS_DEFAULT_ALLOCATOR>
void cds::gc::ptb::details::guard_allocator< ALLOCATOR >::freeList ( guard_data *  pList ) [inline]

Frees list of guards.

The list pList is linked by guard's pThreadNext field. cds::gc::ptb::ThreadGC supporting method
